text: Grevillea rogersoniana, commonly known as the Rogersons' grevillea, is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to a small area on the coast in the Mid West region of Western Australia. The erect, multi-stemmed, non-lignotuberous shrub typically grows to a height of and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple flat spathulate leaves with a blade that is long and wide. It blooms from August to October and produces a terminal raceme irregular inflorescence with pink or brown flowers and pink styles. Later it forms warty ellipsoidal glabrous fruit that is long. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== rogersoniana Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia
title: Grevillea rogersoniana
